items.description: The tidal River Yare from Thorpe St Andrew to Breydon Water
items.message: Levels are now below the localised flood risk thresholds at Haddiscoe. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides or tide locking for the next couple of days. Forecast for Monday evening tides could result in issuing or more localised Flood Alerts.  We will continue to monitor levels closely and update you as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal River Waveney from Ellingham to Breydon Water
items.message: Levels are now below the localised flood risk thresholds at Haddiscoe. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides or tide locking for the next couple of days. Forecast for Monday evening tides could result in issuing of more localised Flood Alerts.  We will continue to monitor levels closely and update you as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message: Please be aware further frontal rainfall is forecast to move in from the west during Saturday 12th February 2022 and this may turn persistent and heavy over the high ground of the Lake District till it clears though during the early evening. The Upper Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and watercourses in Borrowdale as well as Derwentwater itself are likely to respond again on Saturday to this rainfall and result in a Flood Alert being issued. We are monitoring the situation closely and will issue further Flood Alerts and Flood Warnings if required. We advise monitoring weather forecasts for this weekend closely, avoid footpaths close to rivers and streams in the area and driving through any floodwater.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.
